Class Reflection

java.lang.Object
  uk.ac.macaulay.util.Reflection

public class Reflection
extends java.lang.Object

Reflection

Author:
Gary Polhill A utility class providing some easier to use reflection tools.

Method Detail

classImplements

public static boolean classImplements(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                      java.lang.Class<?> iface)
                               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Check that a class implements an interface. An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the iface argument is not an interface.

Parameters:
clazz - The class to check
iface - The interface it implements
Returns:
true if the class implements the methods in the interface, false if not
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

classImplements

private static boolean classImplements(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                       java.lang.Class<?> iface,
                                       java.util.Set<java.lang.Class<?>> visited)
Private method to check whether a class implements all the methods in an interface. Recursively checks all the methods in all interfaces the interface imports.

Parameters:
clazz - The class to check
iface - The interface with methods the class is being checked for
visited - A record of all the interfaces checked
Returns:
true if the class implements all methods in the interface and any interfaces it imports, false otherwise

classHasMethod

public static boolean classHasMethod(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                     java.lang.reflect.Method method)
Check that a class implements a method. The class must have the same parameter types, return type and name.

Parameters:
clazz - The class to check
method - The method
Returns:
true if the class implements the method, false otherwise

classPresent

public static boolean classPresent(java.lang.String name)
Check if a class is present in the current application.

Parameters:
name - The name of the class to check
Returns:
true if the class is present in the application, false otherwise

subType

public static boolean subType(java.lang.Class<?> clazz1,
                              java.lang.Class<?> clazz2)
Check if a class is a subtype or equal to another class. A subtype-or-equal B is true if A extends B or A implements B

Parameters:
clazz1 - The possible subtype
clazz2 - The class or interface to check against
Returns:
true if clazz1 is a subtype or equal to clazz1

getAccessibleFields

public static java.util.Set<java.lang.reflect.Field> getAccessibleFields(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
Return a set of the fields of a class (including inherited fields) that that class can modify. Overridden fields in superclasses are ignored.

Parameters:
clazz - The class
Returns:
A set of fields

getAccessibleFields

public static java.util.Set<java.lang.reflect.Field> getAccessibleFields(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                                                         java.lang.Class<?> type)
Return a set of the fields of a class that the class can modify and have a specified type. Overridden fields in superclasses are ignored.

Parameters:
clazz - The class
type - The type
Returns:
A set of fields

getAccessibleFields

private static java.util.Set<java.lang.reflect.Field> getAccessibleFields(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                                                          java.lang.Class<?> type,
                                                                          boolean superclass,
                                                                          java.util.Set<java.lang.String> names)
Return a set of the fields of a class that the class can modify and have a specified type (which may be null for all types), recursively calling up the class hierarchy to add inherited (but not overridden) fields.

Parameters:
clazz - The class
type - The type
superclass - True if we are recursing in a superclass of the originally called class
names - A list of field names already discovered
Returns:
A set of fields

jarPresent

public static boolean jarPresent(java.lang.String jar)

Parameters:
jar - A jar to check for
Returns:
true if the jar has been loaded

jarPresent

public static boolean jarPresent(java.util.regex.Pattern jar)

Parameters:
jar - A pattern matching one or more jars to check for
Returns:
true if a jar matching the pattern has been loaded (pattern flags are ignored)

jarPatternPresent

public static boolean jarPatternPresent(java.lang.String jarPattern)

Parameters:
jarPattern - A string pattern matching one or more jars to check for
Returns:
true if a jar matching the pattern has been loaded

jarPresent

public static boolean jarPresent(java.lang.String jar,
                                 boolean regexp)

Parameters:
jar - A pattern or exact name of a jar to look for
regexp - true if jar is a pattern
Returns:
true if a matching or equal jar is found

libraryPresent

public static boolean libraryPresent(java.lang.String lib)

Parameters:
lib - The name of a library to look for
Returns:
true if the library is available (a file with that name exists in the Java library path)

libraryPresent

public static boolean libraryPresent(java.util.regex.Pattern lib)

Parameters:
lib - A pattern matching the name(s) of libraries to look for (flags are ignored)
Returns:
true if a file matching the pattern exists in the Java library path

libraryPatternPresent

public static boolean libraryPatternPresent(java.lang.String libPattern)

Parameters:
libPattern - A regular expression matching the name(s) of libraries to look for
Returns:
true if a file matching the pattern exists in the Java library path

libraryPresent

public static boolean libraryPresent(java.lang.String lib,
                                     boolean regexp)

Parameters:
lib - A name or regular expression of a library to look for
regexp - true if lib is a regular expression
Returns:
true if a file with that name or matching the pattern exists in the Java library path
